history.proof: intros Q p q H1 H2. induction H1. - inversion H. subst. + shelve. + shelve. - shelve.

ctx: intros Q p q H1 H2.
exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type A0, A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA, multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n -> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) p : list (Term A n) a, b : Term A n nZb : ~ zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) b p0, q, r : list (Term A n) H3 : canonical A0 eqA ltM (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) P : list (poly A0 eqA ltM) H : inPolySet (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) (exist (fun l0 : list (Term A n) => canonical A0 eqA ltM l0) (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) H3 :: P) H0 : divP A A0 eqA multA divA n a b H1 : eqP A eqA n (spminusf A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec a b nZb p0 q) r H2 : canonical A0 eqA ltM p Unable to unify "reduce ?M2249 (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) ?M2250 ?M2253) ?M2255" with "reduce (exist (fun l0 : list (Term A n) => canonical A0 eqA ltM l0) (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) H3 :: P) p (mults multA (n:=n) (invTerm invA (n:=n) (T1 A1 n)) r)".

ctx: intros Q p q H1 H2.
exceptions.exn: Wrong bullet -: Current bullet - is not finished.

ctx: intros Q p q H1 H2.
exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type A0, A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA, multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n -> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM) p : list (Term A n) a, b : Term A n p0, q : list (Term A n) H1 : reduce Q p0 q H : eqTerm eqA (n:=n) a b H2 : canonical A0 eqA ltM p IHreduce : reduce Q p (mults multA (n:=n) (invTerm invA (n:=n) (T1 A1 n)) q) Unable to unify "reduce ?M2249 (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) ?M2250 ?M2252) (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) ?M2251 ?M2253)" with "reduce Q p (mults multA (n:=n) (invTerm invA (n:=n) (T1 A1 n)) (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q))".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
forall (Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) (p q : list (Term A n)), reduce Q (mults multA (n:=n) (invTerm invA (n:=n) (T1 A1 n)) p) q -> canonical A0 eqA ltM p -> reduce Q p (mults multA (n:=n) (invTerm invA (n:=n) (T1 A1 n)) q)

Premises:

original: intros Q p q H1 H2. induction H1. - intros. inversion H. subst. apply reducetop. auto. - intros. inversion H. subst. apply reduceskip.
